content.text: * Title: Software Testing and Quality Assurance
* Code: CNTT1178
* Credits: 3 (45)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs
+ Exercises in class: 10 hrs
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs
+ Self-study: 60 hrs
* Parallel course(s):
* Prerequisite course(s): CNTT1131, CNTT1116
* Department conducting the course:
+ Faculty: Information Technology; Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334)
+ Lecturers:
1. PhD. Lê Thị Hoài Thu Tel: 0912727529 Email: thulh@neu.edu.vn
2. MSc. Trần Thị Mỹ Diệp Tel: 0904335056 Email: diepttm@neu.edu.vn
* Kind of the course:
* Course language: In English
* Meeting hours: 8 AM – 11 AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University

The course aims to provide students with knowledge of software testing, software, testing procedures and basic techniques in test design and installation testing, and help students develop the ability to design tests and evaluate the effectiveness of testing a specific software in practice. In addition, the course also provides understanding and how to use some of the error management tools, and automation testing tools.
Course content includes:
Overview of software testing
Testing in the software development process
Test plan
Design test case
Methods and techniques testing
Executing test by using tools
Log bugs

The course also aims to train thinking skills, the ability to self-study knowledge, and technology to develop mobile applications by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to learn deeply about technologies, from which they can present in their solutions using new technologies to develop mobile applications.
* Textbooks/Lecture Notes:
Glenford J Myer et.al, (2012), The Art of Software Testing, 3rd, John Wiley & Sons, Inc.
Paul Ammann & Jeff Offutt, (2008), Introduction to Software Testing, Cambridge Press.
[Phạm Ngọc Hùng, Trương Anh Hoàng và Đặng Văn Hưng (2014). Giáo trình kiểm thử phần mềm, Đại học Quốc Gia
Thạc Bình Cường (2011) Kiểm thử và đảm bảo chất lượng phần mềm, Nhà xuất bản Trường Đại Học Bách Khoa Hà Nội.
* Additional references:
[5] Dorothy Graham, (2015), Foundation of Software Testing: ISTQB Certification, Thomson
[6] Andreas Spillner, Tilo Linz, Hans Schaefer. Software Testing Foundations. A Study Guide for the Certified Tester Exam. 4th Edition
[7] Kshirasagar Naik. Software testing and quality assurance theory and practice.
Table 4. Course goals

cells: The course provides students with knowledge about testing software: testing procedures and plans, fundamental techniques in designing and installing test; automation test tools. In addition, the course provides intensive knowledge in testing to analyze and evaluate the quality of software.

column_map.Goals Description: The course provides students with knowledge about testing software: testing procedures and plans, fundamental techniques in designing and installing test; automation test tools. In addition, the course provides intensive knowledge in testing to analyze and evaluate the quality of software.

cells: The course helps students develop communication, presentation, report writing, and time management skills. It provides practical training in professional skills necessary for software testing.

column_map.Goals Description: The course helps students develop communication, presentation, report writing, and time management skills. It provides practical training in professional skills necessary for software testing.

cells: The course contributes to developing the ability to work independently and collaboratively, fostering a correct understanding of responsibilities in task execution and professional ethics.

column_map.Goals Description: The course contributes to developing the ability to work independently and collaboratively, fostering a correct understanding of responsibilities in task execution and professional ethics.

content.text: Table 5. Course learning outcomes (CLOs)

cells: Describe knowledge of software testing: role of software testing (in SDLC), testing process and plan, main techniques in designing and implementing tests; Automated testing, and tools for automation software testing.

column_map.CLOs Description: Describe knowledge of software testing: role of software testing (in SDLC), testing process and plan, main techniques in designing and implementing tests; Automated testing, and tools for automation software testing.

cells: Applying black box and white box testing methods. Distinguish different levels of testing including unit testing, integration testing, and system testing in illustrative examples. Applying different testing techniques to each level of testing.

column_map.CLOs Description: Applying black box and white box testing methods. Distinguish different levels of testing including unit testing, integration testing, and system testing in illustrative examples. Applying different testing techniques to each level of testing.

cells: Applying the testing process from test planning to closure testing activities. Able to write documents related to software testing such as test plans, exit criteria, and error reports (bug log).

column_map.CLOs Description: Applying the testing process from test planning to closure testing activities. Able to write documents related to software testing such as test plans, exit criteria, and error reports (bug log).

cells: Having the skills to search, gather, synthesize, analyze, and present information to solve problems related to software testing.

column_map.CLOs Description: Having the skills to search, gather, synthesize, analyze, and present information to solve problems related to software testing.

cells: Have written communication skills, report writing, and in-depth presentations related to plans, strategies, and implementation of assigned tasks, and have communication skills in the online environment

column_map.CLOs Description: Have written communication skills, report writing, and in-depth presentations related to plans, strategies, and implementation of assigned tasks, and have communication skills in the online environment

cells: Have skills in appropriately applying knowledge, methods, techniques, and testing tools to develop and evaluate software in a particular project.

column_map.CLOs Description: Have skills in appropriately applying knowledge, methods, techniques, and testing tools to develop and evaluate software in a particular project.

cells: Having the ability to self-study and research relevant to complete assigned tasks.

column_map.CLOs Description: Having the ability to self-study and research relevant to complete assigned tasks.

cells: Able to organize team activities; execute and evaluate team members' task quality.

column_map.CLOs Description: Able to organize team activities; execute and evaluate team members' task quality.

cells: Understanding the responsibilities in task execution, and maintaining professional ethics in tasks related to software testing

column_map.CLOs Description: Understanding the responsibilities in task execution, and maintaining professional ethics in tasks related to software testing

cells: Introduction to course Announce classroom rules.

column_map.Teaching and Learning Activities: Introduction to course Announce classroom rules.

cells: Chapter 1. Overview of mobile programming • Basic concepts of software testing • The Role of software testing in SDLC • Category of testing method • Category of testing technique • Category of testing level • Design test: specification test and test case • Principles of testing • Testing process

column_map.Content: Chapter 1. Overview of mobile programming • Basic concepts of software testing • The Role of software testing in SDLC • Category of testing method • Category of testing technique • Category of testing level • Design test: specification test and test case • Principles of testing • Testing process

cells: Chapter 2. Software testing techniques • Black box testing • White box testing

column_map.Content: Chapter 2. Software testing techniques • Black box testing • White box testing

cells: Chapter 3. Testing levels • Unit test • Integration test • System test • Acceptance test • Regression test

column_map.Content: Chapter 3. Testing levels • Unit test • Integration test • System test • Acceptance test • Regression test

cells: Chapter 4. Software errors management • Concepts of software errors • Debugging • Manage software errors

column_map.Content: Chapter 4. Software errors management • Concepts of software errors • Debugging • Manage software errors

cells: Chapter 5. Automation testing • Introduce automated testing • Automated testing process • Assessment advantages and disadvantages of automation test • Automation test tool

column_map.Content: Chapter 5. Automation testing • Introduce automated testing • Automated testing process • Assessment advantages and disadvantages of automation test • Automation test tool

cells: Students take exams according to given schedule

column_map.Teaching and Learning Activities: Students take exams according to given schedule

content.text: Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).

Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.

Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used to take notes for and calculate for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.

2. MSc. Trần Thị Mỹ Diệp Tel: 0904335056 Email: diepttm@neu.edu.vn
* Kind of the course:
* Course language: In English
* Meeting hours: 8 AM – 11 AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University

In addition, the course also provides understanding and how to use some of the error management tools, and automation testing tools.

Students will be divided into groups to learn deeply about technologies, from which they can present in their solutions using new technologies to develop mobile applications.

Glenford J Myer et.al, (2012), The Art of Software Testing, 3rd, John Wiley & Sons, Inc.
Paul Ammann & Jeff Offutt, (2008), Introduction to Software Testing, Cambridge Press.
[Phạm Ngọc Hùng, Trương Anh Hoàng và Đặng Văn Hưng (2014). Giáo trình kiểm thử phần mềm, Đại học Quốc Gia

Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used to take notes for and calculate for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
